website_summaries.verdict: This is a quality shaver at a reasonable price.
pros: This straightforward shaver works as well on the face as it does on the rest of the body
The wet-dry functionality is handy, and the battery charges quickly
cons: The plastic build does not feel as nice as competing brands' shavers

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I am a women and for years I've been using an epilator to remove the hair on my arms. However an epilator is painful, can irritate my skin and even catch/cut loose skin (like elbows), is time consuming and misses a lot of fine hairs. Also they aren't made for curves (elbows, hands). So I decided to try this and I LOVE it!!! Reasons I love it: 1. Great battery life. 2. Has no problem with the curves of your body. 3. Gets ALL the hair the FIRST time! 4. No pain and no skin irritation. 5. Gets the job done quickly. Basically this shaver is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica E.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy black ES-LL41-K
customer_reviews.text: This is apparently a "newer" version of the ES8103S model and it fails miserably in matching the quality of previous razors. The blade system still offers a good shave, but the case is flimsy and it has no indicator for charge level. Also, the additional trimmers are poor compared with a decent trimmer. Stay away from this model and stick with the ES8103S. By the way, I have purchased three Panasonic ES8103S models over the years and I think they're great. For some reason, Amazon prevents me from doing a separate review on the ES-LL41-K.
customer_reviews.author: Chalchiuhtlicue

customer_reviews.title: Bought it a year ago and now the outer foil ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it a year ago and now the outer foil does not work and Panasonic is selling this foil for $40 while a new shaver of the same model is $57 on Amazon!! Definitely would switch to another brand worth my money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic
customer_reviews.text: Tried this after using Norelco for many years. Seems like my last couple of Norelcos were not well made, with the last one lasting only two years. This seems like better quality. Cuts just as well, probably better on my face, but a little more difficult to use on the neck vs a rotary. The only negative is that it's more difficult to clean the screen and blades. Overall, though, I'm very happy with it. Docked it a point because I do have to go back and forth on my neck a few times in different directions to get it done.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver for wonderful price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this exact model for 5+ Years. This is my third one. I only use Panasonic because of the 13k+ RPMs. My first rapid RPM was 2004 and would NEVER use any other kind of shaver. None of the other shavers are that fast. The fast RPMs lessen the likelihood of hair pulling during a shave. I use this exclusively outside (work, gym, travel) while showering. And use a different Panasonic shaver for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Polo

customer_reviews.title: This review is for Panasonic customer service. BUYER BEWARE ...
customer_reviews.text: This review is for Panasonic customer service. BUYER BEWARE that if you have issues with these low quality shavers, you would be responsible for shipping charges and any other fees associated with repairs. My charger stopped working and after contacting customer service they kindly suggested i mail the shaver to a remote address in somewhere in Texas at my cost. Yes, i would not have a shaver during who knows how long, and i would be spending extra money when i paid $80 for a brand new shaver that still has valid warranty. SHAME ON YOU PANASONIC.
customer_reviews.author: J L

customer_reviews.title: I replaced my older Panasonic shaver with this!
customer_reviews.text: So I was happy with my older shaver. Until I dented the shaver by mistake. So I said get another. When I used the older one. I would use it until it went from 100% until 80%. Now with the new one it’s slightly quieter and it has even finer blades. And I keep on trying to see if I need to bring it to 80%. Nope! When it finally gets to 90% I say it’s done! But I probably should just shut it off when it’s still 100%! Excellent shaver! I bought the extended warranty so if I do with the older one I will be covered!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting
customer_reviews.text: Have been using since November 2013, Just September 2020 had to change blades for the first time. 7 year life!! Don't have much hair on face so I only shave once a day in the morning. Battery life is still good will last about two weeks before I charge again. My shaving time is only about three minutes a day. Would buy again when battery doesn't hold a charge. I loved my Braun but the foils and cutting head did not last as long.
customer_reviews.author: Kuya Gee

customer_reviews.title: ... gals for those of you looking to find a good shaver for your legs and underarms
customer_reviews.text: Hey gals for those of you looking to find a good shaver for your legs and underarms, this is it. I tried the "for women" shavers, they wouldn't hold a charge and barely cut butter. This shaves extremely close and stays charged for a long time. Love it. Wish I had found it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Kat in OK

customer_reviews.title: Foil with trimmer is all i need
customer_reviews.text: The one above this the Arc5 will probably be faster, but this is plenty for me. I got to do it in every 2 days or I have to trim it first. I used a foil when i was younger, but i wanted to have a closer shave with a safety razor. 10 Years go by and decide to make my morning routine faster and get a new shaver. I decided to try the other options and after trying all of them found this foil shaver to be the most comfortable. Don't get the cheaper ones unless you plan to shave every day instead of every other.
customer_reviews.author: Brokefool

customer_reviews.title: Wow what a razor!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to replace my aging Philips razor. What a most pleasant surprise to find this one! Once lightly over and it's done and that's the most pleasant and efficient shave I've even experienced. Plus the battery shows you in percentages. I don't have that much growth, but a full charge lasted for over 3 weeks with 40% left! Plus it comes with a cover that would be good for traveling, and easy to clean - just put some hand soap on it, rinse it in running water and turn it on for a few seconds. Beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Display problems but shaves OK
customer_reviews.text: I have used this shaver about 4 years. The display went out while still under warranted, so Panasonic replaced it. The display on the replacement also went out partially while still under warranty. Before I could get around to trying to replace it again, the display started working again. It has continued to function. The shave is fine, not outstanding. The trimmer works well. I wet shave with Cremo. The battery still gives me about 20+ minutes of shave time after 4 years. I rinse it by turning it on under running water. I will probably keep using it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Still works 8 years later!
customer_reviews.text: Shaving daily and have never replaced the blades! Has been great, battery still holding up decently well, it will shutdown at 30% isntead of 0% like it used to but what else can you expect from an 8 year old battery!!! I'm sure the blades need to be replaced (along with the battery) but I'll likely just buy the Arv 4 model instead of replacing the blades as those look a little pricey for a $54 device. Great razor and would buy again given the price but feel it's worth $20 more for the Arc4 at this point. If money is tight buy the Arc3 without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: McB

customer_reviews.title: Waste of YOUR MONEY. DO  NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I dislike this shaver sort of end played myself The enclosed operating instructions said to give a month for beard to get accustomed to shaver WELL IT NEVER DID AND IM BACK TO MY $1 Bic I have the softest and light beard IT DOES NOT SHAVE OUT A LOT OF MONEY PAST ITS REFUND TIME
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Closest shave I’ve had in over a decade
customer_reviews.text: Been a Philips Norelco user for over a decade and cycled through many of their products. Gave this shaver a try and this has the closest shave I’ve had other than using a regular razor. It’s a lot louder than any of the Norelcos I’ve owned but the result more than makes up for it. Battery life is great so far but that’s because it’s new. Using soap and washing it off under running water makes it convenient. Comes with a felt cloth travel case. Initially was put off by the metallic color in the pictures but looks much better in person.
customer_reviews.author: amajohn

customer_reviews.title: LADIES You NEED this!
customer_reviews.text: LADIES! This is a fabulous razor! Almost as close as a blade and it can be used on the sofa, hidden behind your desk at the office or even poolside! I have tried several ladies electric razors and they always disappoint. This one is fabulous. The only thing I wish was improved is battery charge. It charges fast, and I can easily get a full shave on one charge, but it needs to be charged before every use. I highly recommend this shaver for the ladies!
customer_reviews.author: Jeani Buckley

customer_reviews.title: I love this razor and recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great razor right out of the box! I’ve been using Braun and Panasonic electric razors for over 30 years and this is the best one I’ve had. I recommend this product and will buy more of these for gifts for my father and nephew.
customer_reviews.author: Bret barnard

customer_reviews.title: Close Shave; Long Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: This is the closet shave I have been able to obtain from a shaver in this price range. The battery life is also the longest so far. The display screen gives a great count-down as to battery life. I have purchased an electric shaver every year for the last 10 years or so. NOW, I will only need to replace the "blades". This is one of the best purchases that I have made at Amazon both in quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: Patrik Williams

customer_reviews.title: Will probably never buy a different razor again.
customer_reviews.text: I was very unhappy with my Remington. I was ecstatic when it broke. I spent a long time looking at women's razors and their reviews. I just couldn't settle on one. I went online to see what was listed as the best razors. This men's Panasonic came up and it had some a few reviews from women and they were happy. This is what I would call a mid price razor. Sixteen dollars more than my Remington. I am happy I bought it. It gives a good shave and the battery life is good. I reccomend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Smooth
customer_reviews.text: Got this on a Lightning Deal as a change of pace from my usual disposable razors and shaving gel. Very comfortable to hold and gives a smooth, close shave for an electric shaver. Not razor close, but pretty good. Doesn’t pull even with a few days growth. Only downside is it can’t be used while plugged in for charging. But it only takes a few minutes to give it enough juice for a shave. I’ve owned Remington and Braun foil heads and Norelco rotary, but so far I’m liking this one better than the other electrics I’ve used.
customer_reviews.author: J...

customer_reviews.title: High expectations, undesirable results
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and tried it one time, which was very disappointing. The reason I would give it 2 is because I can see it working if you just want to touch up areas, not shave them down. I tried to shave my mustache and beard and there was a bunch of hair still on my face. Plus it can only go one direction and was terrible at versatility. If you’re looking to stay clean cut I would not recommend this product. If you want to do touch ups then yes. But for the price, find something different.
customer_reviews.author: Lesa White

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Effective and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Over the past 15 years I have had 3 of these Panasonic wet/dry shavers. All have been excellent. Daily use, easy clean, great battery life, 12-14 days and long lasting blade and screen (about 12 Months). First one was expensive since at that time it was top of the line. There are many Panasonic models newer than this now but I am glad they still offer this excellent product. Watch pricing and you can grab a deal. Only thing lacking is a Lock on Power Button. I put it in a tube when I travel to stop accidental turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Recently there

customer_reviews.title: Nice shave, can lock and unlock
customer_reviews.text: Worked better than the Phillips circular (ouch) I returned. Smooth and no burns. I had 4 days growth and it plowed through it. Easy to clean and the side trimmer was better than the Phillips too.
customer_reviews.author: DMac

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Razor - High Quality and appears very well made.
customer_reviews.text: Very Loud and annoying. First shave was pretty good. Hope it lasts a while (Later) Now that I've gotten used to this razor I like it very much. Gives close shaves and is way better than the Norelco rotaries I've been using for many years. This is a great razor at a great price. I've been a big fan of Panasonic products for decades. This razor continues that opinion.
customer_reviews.author: SeniorDude

customer_reviews.title: Nice Clean Shave
customer_reviews.text: Shaver is nicely designed, powerful, practical and does the job well. Doesn't irritate my face really. It powers through beard even after 3 - 4 days growth. Cleaning is easy, just rinse or use favourite hand soap as directed in manual. Pop up trimmer is great also. I use the Arc3 mostly in the shower with shaving gel and it's very waterproof. Really makes shaving easy and safe for me. I like the trimmer and recommend. Panasonic is a great manufacturer anyway. Happy shaving.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Christian

customer_reviews.title: Great for teenage son
customer_reviews.text: My son has acne prone skin so I was nervous about purchasing him a razor because I just pictured a bloody mess! I did some research and found this. It doesn't appear to irritate his skin and it does a pretty close shave. He says it's easy to use...which is good or he probably wouldn't use it. It seems to hold a charge well and it cleans up easily. I'm just happy I don't have to see the couple hairs on my son's chin anymore!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Really Excellent Shaver
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Norelco for 45 years but decided to try this one after reading reviews & shopping around. Once the Norelco gets dull, the replacement head(s) are $55 or so, the new R12 head doesn't fit the old R12 setup & the new shavers don't have the pop up sideburn trimmer. So I finally just gave up on my Norelco. This Panasonic is very nice; shaves close & FAST...even if you missed a couple of days & does not pull or chafe skin. Great value for the $$. But my old Panasonic Thruster Speakers on the back Patio still sound better than this razor!!
customer_reviews.author: Bo Deadley

customer_reviews.title: A Close Enough Shave.
customer_reviews.text: I have always used a razor for shaving. I now really love using the Panasonic Electric shaver. Although the shave is not as close as a razor, it is close enough to be in the running with a razor. Comfortable to use and does not leave any cuts or razor burn. One charge allows you to get a minimum of seven shaves. You do have to allow your beard about a month to adapt to this style of shaving. I no longer use a razor and am extremely satisfied with my new shaver.
customer_reviews.author: REC

customer_reviews.title: He was looking for something that provided a super close shave without irritation
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a firefighter so he has to shave daily. He was looking for something that provided a super close shave without irritation. This definitely does the job. It's easy to use, easy to clean and he loves that it displays the battery percentage. No more guessing if it's going to die mid-shave! The head is flexible which allows for a very close and quick shave.
customer_reviews.author: Jena T

customer_reviews.title: Not very good electric shaver
customer_reviews.text: Not a great shaver, if I need to follow up with a straight blade what's the point of this. Battery is powerful enough to last for a month of shaving three or four days a week. Head is easy to remove for cleaning. Unit is light to hold. Unit is small enough for traveling and not bulky. Overall would be great but I bought this unit to shave not carry in my hand or in a bag. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: AB77

customer_reviews.title: I'm going to find a better one and take this one to my local homeless ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I missed the return window due to some personal issues. The razor just doesn't shave well unless you apply tons of pressure which is not pleasurable and leaves my face red. My ole Norelco was smooth and just floated over my skin. I have a smaller face maybe this is for another shape face but I would not buy it again. I'm going to find a better one and take this one to my local homeless shelter and donate it.
customer_reviews.author: robert ramirez

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL SHAVE
customer_reviews.text: Really lousy shave....Especially around the neck area. I feel like I have a tug of war going on when I use it.. The Norelco rotary gives a better shave but was hard to clean. I'm going to try a Braun If not Back to the blades
customer_reviews.author: GERALD MALEY

customer_reviews.title: Need replacement after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Really nice and functions as expected, no issues with build quality. But I must be old school expecting it to continue working after 3 years. I've owned two expecting the issue was from a fall on a hard floor, this second did not have such abuse. The mechanism which vibrates the blades, gets stuck. Taking it apart I see it uses electromagnetic techniques which would mean specific adjustments or part replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Great!
customer_reviews.text: For the first time in my life, I've found an electric razor that works almost as well as a 5-blade disposable razor cartridge. I have shaving, and if I could, I'd have every hair on my face permanently removed. But since I can't, this razor will do nicely. My first few shaves are nice and close, plus its easy to clean and charged quickly. I like that it works wet or dry, and that it has a replaceable battery.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Good Head Shaver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this shaver about 3 weeks ago. I use it only for shaving my head about every 2-3 days. I previously used a Norelco shaver. This shaver has provided a superior head shave for me. It shaves cleanly and gently compared to my previous shaver. I do require a couple of passes with the shaver to get a perfect head shave but this is true with anything I have used on my head. I clean it as directed with soap and water following washing my hair. I have only dry shaved and not yet used shaving cream with it as it is able to do. I would recommend this shaver to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: regular reader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: My husband love this electric shaver. He has supper sensitive skin and with this shaver he doesn’t have any problems at all. No irritation
customer_reviews.author: Janine Santana

customer_reviews.title: Good for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: I used an electric shaver years ago and never really liked it much. I usually use Harry's blades which I love. But I wanted something that I could use sometimes for a fast touch-up or if I just didn't want to shave with a blade. This works well for that, however I don't think it shaves as close as a blade. It doesn't burn or pull, and the charge seems to last a long time. It's also pretty easy to clean. So I think it is a good reasonably priced shaver, but I don't think I could use it every day. The shave just isn't close enough.
customer_reviews.author: Hammerhead

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Shaver for Beards with Strong Grain
customer_reviews.text: My beard is extremely difficult to shave. My whiskers poke out, take one look around, and then immediately take a U-turn and try to burrow back into my face. I've been through MANY electric shavers in my 58 years, and I've settled on Panasonics for a while. The Remington triple foil also does well on a beard with strong grain like mine, but Remingtons are LOUD. Deafening. The Panasonic is as quiet as it can possibly be, I think, and still actually be able to cut through the timber that is my whiskers. The only fault I can come up with is that the popup trimmer does not work particularly well so my sideburns are always a bit scraggly.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan L Heal

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for his 1st Father's day and he loves it! It is easy to use and it gives him a clean shave. I was nervous as I don't buy men's trimmers but the reviews were so good I decided to take a chance. My husband has had it for months and continues to love it so money well spent. Can't ask for more!
customer_reviews.author: IndyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Get This
customer_reviews.text: I got new blades for my old one and noticed Amazon had this awesome Prime Only deal under $50 so got another one for my son. This is a very nice electric shaver, closer shaves than past Norelco or Remington triple head rotary deals. Just replace the foil and blades after 2-4 years depending on how rugged a beard you grow. I waited 4 years because the beard is not so manly. The old shaver is like new again.
customer_reviews.author: M. S.

customer_reviews.title: Simply great!!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an electric razor for my teenager and this is great! Searched reviews on all kinds of electric razors and some were very pricey. Bought a few cheap ones from some discount stores around me and they didn't work or scratched up my teen's face with razor burn. This Panasonic razor is so much better than anything we tried! Works very well, no razor burn and gives my son a clean shaven face. He uses this on a dry face so far. Although you can use this wet too. So far this razor works very good! Battery lasts long too. Battery charges fast also. Very happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Tamh

customer_reviews.title: ... one of these 5 years ago and I was glad to see they are still making it
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these 5 years ago and I was glad to see they are still making it. This is my second one and I have zero complaints. Heavy beards are no problem and it is the best electric razor I have ever owned and there has been many. The high speed motor really makes shaving easy. I am replacing the entire unit because my current one's motor works fine but is a little lounder and the cost of a new set of blades ($30ish) is almost half the cost of a new one.
customer_reviews.author: ARH

customer_reviews.title: Shaver is fine, but I thought the blades would have lasted ...
customer_reviews.text: Shaver is fine, but I thought the blades would have lasted a lttle longer. Only had it for about a month and it no longer does as a good a job as it did initially. I find myself having to go over same spots over and over to get a reasonably close shave. I guess I may need to buy new blades already? I expected the blades to last longer than a month. Battery charge seems to last for about 5 shaves, thought it would be better too. Unit feels good and comfortable, but did expect the blades to last longer. Wonder if replacement blades would be of better quality? Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: JCEP

customer_reviews.title: The replacement model is not compatible with the cleaning station but easily cleans up by running cold water through the heads
customer_reviews.text: I bought the ES8103S as a replacement when my very similar ES8109S would no longer hold a battery charge. The shaver being replaced came with a power cleaning station that worked well, but that I only used once. The replacement model is not compatible with the cleaning station but easily cleans up by running cold water through the heads, with the added benefit of having a lower price. Two suggestions if you buy the ES8103S: First, it gives a very clean, comfortable shave if you use shaving cream as it is a wet/dry shaver. Second, I got very long battery life by not recharging until 10% charge was left, and removing from the charger immediately once it reaches 100% charge.
customer_reviews.author: Electroniker

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbage
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't shave fine hairs on face or whiskers that are oriented close to face. My wife's Remington WDF-4840 does a much better job! Fell apart after 1 week of use. Bent foil. Complete garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Rich vSB

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I waited so long to replace my old bosch
customer_reviews.text: So fast, it saves me 2 minutes a day X 360 days a year ( I don't shave EVERY day) for a total of 12 hours each year. That's 10 days in the next 20 years. So I'm going on vacation. Thanks Panasonic
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Carlson

customer_reviews.title: does not give a close shave.
customer_reviews.text: worst shave ever. seriously. this product doesn't even come close to resembling a shave. the interceptor cutter between the foils irritates the skin just as bad as razor burn, if not worse because you don't even get a decent shave with this product. this shaver gives the same effect as shaving with a neck trimmer or battery operated clipper. a neck trimmer will actually get closer to the skin if used properly. should have sent back immediately but tried to make it work. overpriced garbage. huge waste of $65. heavy beards and sensitive skin beware.
customer_reviews.author: AMZN-shopper

customer_reviews.title: Battery not holding
customer_reviews.text: I charged this for a full day prior to use. I used it twice so far and the battery is at 50%. Battery life should be much better. It does get a close shave however the bag is comes with has no room for charger either. If battery held better I'd give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: CookieMonsters

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my boyfriend as I wanted him to ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my boyfriend as I wanted him to have the option of dry and wet shaves. I may not be the right person to review this product but I thought I would give some color. Dry shaves - works well and quickly. Wet shave - I bought him the Art of Shaving stuff because dry shaves with his old razor was causing ingrown hairs and bumpy skin. So now once a week he wet shaves, and I can tell you his skin has improved and the shave is close.
customer_reviews.author: BooksIRead

customer_reviews.title: Average at best
customer_reviews.text: The shaver is okay. Doesn't give as close a shave as my previous Phillips AquaTouch closeout that I got for 35$, go figure. The attached trimmer is good for accuracy but struggles miserably against a two week beard. My previous Phillips handled a month old beard with absolute ease. I chose this because of many reviews I had found on the web, but I have to say it's smack bang average. I'm not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Bhavikshah Atulkumar

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: Price was good, it still does not get my neck whiskers that good in my opinion. If I let it grow too long it really struggles. I've used a razor for a decade and tired of ingrowns so gave this a try. It's really helped out with that a ton. Not the close shave I'm used to but I always look clean every day. That was the downside to a regular razor, I'd go days because my skin would get too irritated. This takes care of 98% and the other 2% I get with my regular razor
customer_reviews.author: Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Close to a blade...
customer_reviews.text: Granted you will never find an electric shaver that shaves as close as a blade. Having said that, this shaver gets pretty darn close. I love it and would recommend it to anyone. One caution when using electric shavers is that if you press too hard in hopes of getting the closest shave possible, you might cause in grown hair. But with this shaver, I've found that light pressure results in a very close shave without any negative side affects. If you are considering an electric shaver and don't have an unlimited budget, this is the one to get!
customer_reviews.author: rhall37735

customer_reviews.title: Charged it in half an hour and enjoyed a wonderful shave
customer_reviews.text: Just received it today. Charged it in half an hour and enjoyed a wonderful shave. My old Es-LT41 needed a new fill and cutter, but instead opted for a new shaver with a new battery, etc. Boy am I pleased! 8.17.20 Still enjoying my razor. Using it three times a week, the inner cutter gets replaced annually. When replaced it’s as good as new. Luv, luv it. Also my backup is the small Panasonic ES831, battery operated single blade foil shaver. Also my favorite for years. 😊
customer_reviews.author: MacBobT

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, not too noisy, seems well built. But you'll never get a completely smooth shave from it, no matter how many times you run it over your face. A cheap disposable razor and cheap shaving cream will get you a closer shave.
customer_reviews.author: ZeloGuy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Amazing shave for the price. Quieter than my old Braun 5-series and closer, more comfortable shave. Super easy to clean with just soap and water. Couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: bach fan

customer_reviews.title: Fast and efficient
customer_reviews.text: Just received this shaver couple days ago. Immediately noticed that it takes me much less time to shave ( compared to my Braun electric that I've used for years. ) The Panasonic has a larger foil shaving surface so it takes about half the time to get the job done. Also, the new shaver gives me a much closer shave compared to the Braun. It may fall apart tomorrow but so far, I couldn't be more pleased. Mike in NC
customer_reviews.author: janna underwood

customer_reviews.title: Happy with results.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace 10 year old Norelco triple header. Once I got used to the different cutting style , I m happy with it. Sharp, holds good charge and easier to clean. Works great wet or dry.
customer_reviews.author: SMS.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you'll love it
customer_reviews.text: This is SO much better than my Norelco rotary that it's hard to compare. I get a blade quality shave in less than half the time. The rotary needed five or six tries to get just a somewhat acceptable cut. I write this two hours after use and my skin is still smooth. And this just gets better and faster with each use. The difference in power is easily detectable by the sound. This sounds like a modern dentist drill while the rotary sounds like an antique belt driven one. The old one is going in the trash so I don't inflict it on some poor soul in a donation center.
customer_reviews.author: Jim V.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, just didn't preform like I hoped
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with the product until it came to shaving my neck...it was impossible, it performed well on my face, close shave wet and dry, but I spent countless times contorting and pulling my face to get it to cut hair on my upper neck, it just wouldn't, makes it useless in my eyes, if I still have to use a regular razor to touch up, I'd rather just do it all with the razor and be done with it. Decided to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: Alex G

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic ES8103S Pro-Curve Wet/Dry Rechargeable Linear Pivot Action Shaving System, Silver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this razor for my husband. I reviewed all the comments from the gentlemen who have this razor, and decided this was the best razor for the price. While I am happy with the fact that my husband is happy for the most part...we both are unhappy with the fact that it will not run with the cord inserted in the razor. If you forget to charge it and the charge is out of the razor, you are out of luck. Otherwise, it is quiet, runs well, my husbands says it cleans well, cuts well, and overall, he likes it. Except, for this one drawback.
customer_reviews.author: VLPinVA

customer_reviews.title: Wow I’m impressed
customer_reviews.text: I love this electric. For 20 years I stuck with my trusty Pany ES4026 and clones. Finally it broke. I thought I was doomed. Luckily Pany has made a major winner here. Smooth shaving with no cuts or pulls. Battery lasts. Easy to clean. Yeah!
customer_reviews.author: ILikeAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Very Loud.  Not Wet/DRY -  Fine performance for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The prices on electric razors are wildly varied. This one was definitely on the less expensive side. It is NOT wet /dry.. The box is misleading since it has a picture implying shower use. Luckily I read the reviews before using (but after buying). I suppose I could have returned but it is "good enough". Quite loud as well. Very basic, feels rather Old School.
customer_reviews.author: KMeyer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to use, does a very decent job, battery life is quite good
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one of these shavers Due to the fairly high cost of the replacement screen and blades, I find it better to get a whole new setup with new battery after a few years. I use it dry, and wash it after each shave which I do about twice a week (I'm retired). I think I can get three or four shaves per charge. While the shave quality is quite good, I always come in afterwards and use a blade and cream to finish the job. Overall, for the price I recommend this shaver and think it is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: gregincary

customer_reviews.title: It's a good razor but:::::::
customer_reviews.text: It was quiet and we'll constructed, used it one time, it shaved well but after 3 minutes of shaving the foul head became got and could not hold against face. Upon further research of reviews found that over3 minutes of extensive rise the shaved head becomes hot as mine did. I could not shave in 3 minutes
customer_reviews.author: mike leahr

customer_reviews.title: This thing really works
customer_reviews.text: I'm old and after years of trying electric razors I gave up and just used cream and blade. But being retired lathering up got to be a pain and I decided to try an electric and spend more. The saying you get what you pay for is true. This Panasonic Shaver really works great. As good as a blade and so much easier. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Never liked electric shavers in the past
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Never liked electric shavers in the past, decided to test & try this (based upon Amazon Reviews) and I must admit I will never go back to straight razor, I would have never believed an electric could shave as close (smooth) as a straight razor BUT this shaves even closer and better, simply amazing (so smooth & ever any nick or ingrown hair bumps, after roughly 4 month of use. Bottom line - Get one, you will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Beyond ecstatic
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my dad after his 15 year old Braun electric shaver. After looking at about 20 razors he decided on this one. And he absolutely LOVES it! He says other than a straight razor shave by a barber this is the first one that gave him a shave as soft as a baby's face. He has thick polish/Irish hair and over the last 50 years he hasn't found a razor that could give him a this amazing shave, not even the $150 braun.
customer_reviews.author: Sara y

customer_reviews.title: Great for shaving your head!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product back in 2013 to shave my head as I was going bald and since then, I've change the blades and top screen every six months and the electric shaver still works like new. I shave my head in dry and it's super easy and fast! I highly recommend this product to anyone that wants to shave your head! Just FYI if you are going to use it for traveling make sure you keep the top protection because the top screen is very delicate and it bents easily and once that happens then it's a really rough shave!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Marcano

customer_reviews.title: even when using the super lubricating venus spa blades
customer_reviews.text: I'm a female and have always had issues with eczema and dry skin. I can only use a bladed razor to shave my legs about twice a week, even when using the super lubricating venus spa blades. This electric razor is incredible and I can use it every single day without any irritation. Unfortunately you really do have to shave every day since it doesn't get as close to the skin as a manual, bladed razor, but it is still an amazing shave. It's gentle enough to use on the bikini area, underarms, back of the neck (I have a short hair cut), etc. I highly recommend this razor for women and men, alike!
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: What an improvement from the version of many years ago!
customer_reviews.text: I had a version of this probably 20 years ago, and it was a real disappointment. When Amazon had this on a lightning deal for 40 bucks, I decided to try again. What an improvement! I love this razor. I still use an old-fashioned blade when I want to get a really close shave, but this thing takes me 85% of the way to a great shave, maybe 90%. I mainly use it for a quick trim, or on a morning/evening when I don't have to have a super-close shave...when the shave has to be good, but not super clean. Man, this thing is awesome and I'm so glad I gave it another chance.
customer_reviews.author: 4 Sure

customer_reviews.title: Great Electric Shaver
customer_reviews.text: I've been a traditional shavor with either the Gillette power fusion or something similar, but I was tired of shaving and sometimes cutting my mole (which is very handsome when not gushing blood) and continually going to the store for shaving supplies. So, I wanted to try an electric again. My past experiences with the circular rotating heads wasn't great, as it didn't provide a close shave and irritated my skin. I read some reviews that pointed to this Panasonic. And, I've been more than pleasantly surprised. After a few weeks, I find I'm getting a close shave and no irritation. I am very happy with this purchase, especially for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Polarbear33

customer_reviews.title: Best shaver I've ever had. Bye Bye Braun
customer_reviews.text: Best shaver I've ever owned and I've owned way too many Brauns before finally going with Panasonic. This shaved closer than any Braun I've had. The swivel head is wonderful. And though this is a wet/dry shaver, it took me awhile to trust taking it in the shower. Using it wet was no problem at all. The only 'hiccup' I can think of is that this will not shave while it is plugged in for charging so if you're in a bind and the shaver needs charging that might be a drawback.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ribeiro

customer_reviews.title: Great unit for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a few Panasonic razors. They perform very well and cut my heavy beard quickly. Water rinse is very convenient but replacement blade and foil is 2/3rd the cost of a new razor! The good news is they last for at least a year. Check out replacement blades before considering any electric. Use this in the shower with shave cream or use it dry when in a pinch!
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: It's a great shaver but it has a major issues
customer_reviews.text: It's a great shaver but it has a major issues: 1. LCD screen will stop working after a couple months. I've had two of these now and both ended up with a dead LCD screen. 2. Both my shavers had their batteries die in 2 years. I was really hoping I could use this for at least 4 years. But I've had to switch after 2 years and now I have to buy it again. Still looking for the perfect shaver.
customer_reviews.author: WONHAK LEE

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: very impressed so far. shaves have been very clean and close. blades are easy to clean. recharging is fast (about an hour for full charge). I can get about 10 days of use on single charge. Placement of pop-out shaver is so-so but overall this has been a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: WanderLust

customer_reviews.title: Stylish Razor with fair performance is prone to leave you unshaven... often.
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely designed electric razor at an attractive price (when I bought). Gives a very comfortable shave, though not nearly as close as a Braun shaver of older but similar design. Also be aware that this model will NOT allow shaving while it Charges. If you stop off at home for a shave and quick change before an appointment or occasion and the battery is drained, you will need a backup razor or have to show up unshaven... a bummer! This unit also seems to lose charge on batteries much faster (without use) than other brands and models, so be prepared to go out unshaven more often with this razor than with many others.
customer_reviews.author: eNGeeNC

customer_reviews.title: Powerful consistent shave
customer_reviews.text: I liked this shaver so much that I bought one for my father as well. It cuts right through my thick beard and holds a charge well. I've never used it wet but I have rinsed the head which keeps it much cleaner than just shaking it out. Performs consistently. My old shaver was garbage so not a really good comparison point, and I haven't used a very high end model to compare against this, but I'm a big fan.
customer_reviews.author: AZC NJ

customer_reviews.title: Good shaver
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on and off for 6 years, it still holds a charge and works flawlessly. My wife uses it to shave her legs also. I've replaced the head once. Just recently bought one for a friend as a gift and another for the wife who was traveling and wasn't taking mine.
customer_reviews.author: BRUCE C

customer_reviews.title: Best razor I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best razor I have ever used. Daily use for 2+ weeks on a single charge. I have been shaving daily for 3.5 years and the battery still holds a charge like the first day I got it. I replaced the blades last year and did not notice a performance benefit; I am guessing you could go almost 5 years without replacing the blades. NOTE: I did not figure out how to use the trimmer properly for the first 2 years of use. You have to press the trimmer switch as you are using it to get the trimmer to gear up with the motor. When this is done properly the trimmer is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: James Rudolph Rowland IV

customer_reviews.title: Close, comfortable shave with high speed motor
customer_reviews.text: The ES8103S Arc3 has been great. It's easy to clean, and you can use shaving cream if you like. Dry or wet, it's comfortable and gets the job done. It's probably the higher motor speed that makes it more effective for me than the Norelco I had used for years. My bear grows in swirly patterns, so I have to go over a few spots repeatedly with any shaver, but this Panasonic gets it done smoother and faster, and with no skin irritation. I didn't think I'd ever switch from Norelco heads to a foil head after being disappointed with a Braun several years ago, but this one has been excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: First razor for my teen
customer_reviews.text: My son was using Jolene to bleach his light brown beginning mustache. When it became obvious the mustache was getting too thick, I bought this for him and he just loves using it. He uses it with shaving cream and it leaves his skin very smooth for at least a week. Holds a long charge.
customer_reviews.author: Grietsion

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't shave worth a darn!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband who has Parkinson's Disease to help him. Does a terrible job. He has gine back to a razor which I help him with. Just doesn't shave his beard no matter how we try. Very disappointed. The window for return has passed. I guess we are stuck.
customer_reviews.author: C. Shaddick

customer_reviews.title: Better than shaving with a razor though as i just ...
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using this type of shaver for shaving my head. It takes a while and rubbing up and down in same place to get the desired fully shaven effect. Better than shaving with a razor though as i just rub it all over my head and no need to worry about cutting myself. I do get a bit of bumps on the back of my.hesd after this but way less than a razor.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't shave with anything else
customer_reviews.text: I have been shaving with PANASONIC shavers since the early 90's. This is my fifth PANASONIC shaver in over 25 years. I get a better shave with it than a blade type razor and it doesn't pull like a blade razor. The shaving action is smooth and comfortable. This is the second ES8103S that I have owned. The first one lasted about 7 years.....it still works but I think something is worn out in the shaving head because it doesn't shave as close as it used to, even with new blades and foil. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Fredrick H.

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic shaver
customer_reviews.text: I have had Braun and Norelco and Remington (Remington is just pitiful) shavers. While the first two, Braun and Norelco are pretty good, this Panasonic is way ahead of them. Very close shave, easy cleanup and great battery life. Won't get anything else in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Angela L. Seaman

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a Braun razor guy for more than twenty years until I spent the money and got a really crappy razor. I suffered with it for months until I just gave up. I read some reviews and settled on this one. I could not be happier. Just the sound of this thing exudes quality. My shave time is less than a minute. One swipe is baby butt smooth. No more rolling over the same spot again and again applying pressure. This thing is fantastic! Thank You!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shave
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Close shave. Battery lasts several shaves and charges fast. No skin irritation after. I like to have an electric razor for travel when I don't feel like fussing and this one gives me the closest shave of the several I've tried over the years. When available as "Deal of the day" it's a steal. Update 10/16/15. I've had this shaver a while. Just replaced the blades because it wasn't as smooth as when I first got it. Now it's like day 1 again. The blades were expensive, but once a year or so I guess it's necessary. I like it so much I bought another one for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: I switched from Braun to Panasonic with big doubt, YET I like it more than Braun now................... Good quality and it does its work perfect
customer_reviews.author: 이 블라드

customer_reviews.title: electric shaver vs razor blade
customer_reviews.text: Most people don't realize that the technique using an electric shaver differs from a razor blade type shaver. Electric shavers takes a little longer. The best way TO LEARN IS IN FRONT of a magnifying mirror. Once mastered, you will enjoy the convenience of this tool for life!
customer_reviews.author: ELH INC

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I've been using electric shavers for probably 40 years, and I've tried most brands. Overall, I'm a Remington man. The Remingtons do the best job shaving my fairly heavy beard, and their trimmers are nice and wide for a bit of a trim around the ears. Unfortunately, my favorite model is out of production, so I tried Panasonic for the first time. What I like about this razor is that it's really quiet and the battery lasts a long time on a single charge. Unfortunately, it doesn't do that great a job shaving my face, especially the long hairs on my neck and those high on my cheeks. I use a disposable razor to clean up what the Panasonic misses.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Baker

customer_reviews.title: Nice transaction, fast ship
customer_reviews.text: Nice transaction, fast ship..not sure if my face fits too well with electric shavers. This is my first. I got it to really just knock down the tree like stubble I get after 2 or 3 days that dulls any razor down to a single use. This does knock down the stubble well enough I can do a final shave with a good razor without having to throw it out after a single use. So this should help in that cost down the road and pay for itself in some time. Would have given 5 stars, but maybe its just my situation...it might give a closer shave for others.
customer_reviews.author: Pacific Islander

customer_reviews.title: Great razor.
customer_reviews.text: I admit the line up of available Panasonic razors was intimidating when I started out, so there might even be a better fit for you. For me, the wet / dry shave ability is the clincher. I scoffed at first about the wet shave, no razor could put up with the clogging mess, I thought. I was wrong. I've been using this for months and it's still the closest, most comfortable shave I've ever had. As another reviewer has said, if you have sensitive skin this is the shave for you. I lather up with my cheap Barbasol shave cream and let this razor do it's magic. Light touch and your beard is gone. A great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hansen

customer_reviews.title: 4th One in the Series for me, great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a value decision for me. I can't tell any difference between the ES8103S (previously ES8109) and the $200-$300 shavers. My beard is heavy but not dense. I may be a shaving Luddite, but pivoting heads (I use this one locked) and exotic cleaning systems are a waste of time and money for me. I clean this with liquid dishwashing soap, takes about a minute, let it dry and hit it with a quick shot of Remington Shaver Saver. Replace the blades and foils every 8 to 9 months and it's good for about 3 years, after that the batteries won't hold a charge for more than one or two shaves.
customer_reviews.author: Tom D

customer_reviews.title: Second one I get!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the second one I bought. Almost as good and economical as DE shaving, but faster to use when you include setup and cleaning. Given how simple, yet powerful and useful it is (faster and more precise than a three-head rotary shaver for me.), I could not resist the super sale! The first one has served me well for over 4 years with one change of blades and foil and is still going strong, but I plan to stop changing em and use it only for travel. I hope the new one serves me well for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Alex G.

customer_reviews.title: Good shaver, but digital display fails.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in September 2010, after being highly satisfied with previous Panasonic shavers. In less than a year, the digital display failed--so I could no longer monitor the amount of charge remaining in the battery. Since it was still under warranty, I sent it back to Panasonic for repair or replacement. They sent me a replacement. In less than a year, the display on the replacement also began to fail, so I could no longer determine the state of charge. On a positive note, I still have this shaver and it shaves very well. But the unreliable display is a serious inconvenience, and is clearly a problem with this model.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Cleary

customer_reviews.title: It good and gives cleaner shave than the Phillips one that I have
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is not as good as the phillips one. I guess 7-9 shaves is what you get in one full charge
customer_reviews.author: Brikesh Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as my old one.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my Panasonic ES-SA40-K which worked great for years. This model was a disappointment. It did not shave well. I could not get it to shave under my nose, just did not fit. It was difficult to keep clean. I does not mount on the charger like my old one. The trimmer does not latch in place making it difficult to use. After a few months of use, I am throwing it away.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Loughlin

customer_reviews.title: Best shave ever but...
customer_reviews.text: Shane's better than any razor I've owned including a Braun, Norelco or Remington. The only gripe I have is that if you shave with it dry instead of in the shower as it's designed the heads get rather warm and can be uncomfortable at times. Shave with it in the shower as it was designed and you won't have
customer_reviews.author: BBG

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I have always used Braun and bottom line is they really are the best. I had a Synchpro which, while large and heavy gave a great, close and smooth shave. This may become my back up/travel shaver. Pros: The Panasonic is compact, light and sits well in the hand. The trimmer cuts nicely. Cons: It's a battle to get a smooth shave. I feel it pulling as it cuts, particularly on the upper lip area. Leaves my face a little sore which i never got with Braun shavers. I gave it a few months to see if it's just my skin adapting, but to no avail. The battery also doesnt last particularly long.
customer_reviews.author: JJbrit

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Shave
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my Dad. I plan to get one because he & I both agree, it makes your face feel so smooth. For the best shave run it under water then shave half way, then repeat. Glides perfectly. He & I VERY PLEASED. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

product_meta.title: Panasonic Electric Shaver and Trimmer for Men ES8103S Arc3, Wet/Dry with 3 Nanotech Blades and Flexible Pivoting Head
product_meta.description: Style Name:Arc3 ES8103SThe fully loaded Panasonic Electric Shaver and Trimmer for Men ES8103S Arc3, Wet/Dry with 3 Nanotech Blades and Flexible Pivoting Head is packed with smart, innovative features that deliver a remarkably close and comfortable shave. The ES8103S electric razor is a three-blade shaving system for outstanding shaver coverage and closeness. Panasonic Arc3 men's shavers feature 30-degree angle blades to cut hair at its base for close, accurate precision. The flexible pivoting head allows the cordless shaver to float effortlessly along the contours of your face for a clean shave, especially around your sideburns and under your chin. The Panasonic shaver has a fast, linear motor to help eliminate the tugging and pulling that may occur with slower electric razors, while maintaining peak power right up until the end of the charge. The Panasonic ES8103S men's three-blade electric shaving system with Nanotech blades comes equipped with a travel pouch, hypoallergenic blades and foils for sensitive skin, a pop-up shaving trimmer, and an AC recharger. The convenient wet/dry design lets you shave and trim in the shower or bath with foam, gel or soap lather and dry by holding under warm water to rinse away hair stubble and residue. Like all Panasonic shavers for men, blades and foil should be replaced when dull to ensure the best electric shaver performance. Panasonic Shaver ES8103S Replacement accessories: Men’s Razor Foil (WES9087PC), Electric Razor Blade (WES9068PC), and Men’s Razor Combo Set (WES9013PC).
feature_bullets: Sharp men’s shaver blades: Panasonic arc3 men's electric shaver with three ultra sharp nanotech blades and ultra-thin arc foil follow facial contours for a quick, close and comfortable shave
Wet/dry electric shaver and trimmer 2 in 1: Build-in pop up trimmer details mustaches, beards and sideburns; Wet/dry waterproof shaver allows for convenient shaving in or out of the shower
Flexible pivoting head: Panasonic flexible pivoting electric shaver head glides effortlessly to trace the individual contours of face, chin, neck and jaw
High performance motor with a linear drive: This Panasonic shaver is equipped with a linear motor which delivers 13,000 cuts per minute and maintains peak power up to the end of every battery charge

LCD battery indicator and sonic cleaning: The shaver’s 10 stage Lcd shows battery status at a glance, and sonic vibration cleaning mode removes stubble easily; Rechargeable, portable and travel friendly

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
